ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawl jobs occasionally getting stuck
ygData.msgSnippet: I haven t seen this before. FWIW, 1.14.1 moved to BDB-JE version 3.3.62 (whereas I believe 1.14.0 used BDB-JE 3.2.76). I don t have any specific reason to

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawl jobs occasionally getting stuck
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=_IJ8tmzxwrTHSs8tshwy8u4gYltrMEczezTgtgYf6KTD
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I haven't seen this before.

FWIW, 1.14.1 moved to BDB-JE version 3.3.62 (whereas I believe 1.14.0 
used BDB-JE 3.2.76). I don't have any specific reason to thing a problem 
in 3.3.62 could be responsible for what you're seeing, but seeing if a 
problem recurs in later versions may be worth trying. You could move to 
Heritrix 1.14.1 or just try a later BDB-JE JAR, which is reliably 
drop-in compatible with older versions. (Though, the on-disk format is 
sometimes not backward-compatible.)

If it recurs and you want to diagnose further, info to collect would 
include:

* OS/JVM versions and processor/architecture
* what are the other BDB-JE threads doing/locking?
* these stacks look like a crawler finishing, while your earlier 
question seemed to suggest a stall during startup -- are these separate, 
correlated, similar, etc.?

- GOrdon @ IA

Matt Kent wrote:
> I ran into the problem again today and I think I have a more specific
> question to ask now.
> 
> I found my processes in a situation where all ten toe threads were
> stuck. Nine of the ten toe threads were in this state:
> 
> "ToeThread #8: " prio=10 tid=0x09454c00 nid=0x6a1b waiting for monitor
> entry [0xb4a51000..0xb4a51ec0]
>    java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.toeEnded(CrawlController.java:1815)
> 	- waiting to lock <0x88dc4998> (a org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob$MBeanCrawlController)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:186)
> 
> And the tenth toe thread was in this state:
> 
> "ToeThread #9: " prio=10 tid=0x09ba6c00 nid=0x6a1c in Object.wait() [0xb506c000..0xb506cf40]
>    java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)
> 	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.txn.LockManager.lock(LockManager.java:227)
> 	- locked <0x71e2f020> (a com.sleepycat.je.txn.BasicLocker)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.txn.BasicLocker.lockInternal(BasicLocker.java:94)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.txn.Locker.lock(Locker.java:257)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.dbi.CursorImpl.lockLNDeletedAllowed(CursorImpl.java:2375)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.dbi.CursorImpl.lockLN(CursorImpl.java:2297)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.dbi.CursorImpl.searchAndPosition(CursorImpl.java:1983)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.dbi.DbTree.modifyDbRoot(DbTree.java:336)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.recovery.Checkpointer.flushIN(Checkpointer.java:750)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.recovery.Checkpointer.flushDirtyNodes(Checkpointer.java:669)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.recovery.Checkpointer.syncDatabase(Checkpointer.java:571)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.dbi.DatabaseImpl.sync(DatabaseImpl.java:545)
> 	- locked <0x88dcab98> (a com.sleepycat.je.dbi.DatabaseImpl)
> 	at com.sleepycat.je.Database.sync(Database.java:322)
> 	at org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap.close(CachedBdbMap.java:315)
> 	- locked <0x88dc59e0> (a org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap)
> 	at org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap.clear(CachedBdbMap.java:422)
> 	- locked <0x88dc59e0> (a org.archive.util.CachedBdbMap)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.admin.StatisticsTracker.finalCleanup(StatisticsTracker.java:232)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.AbstractTracker.crawlEnded(AbstractTracker.java:321)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.admin.StatisticsTracker.crawlEnded(StatisticsTracker.java:869)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.sendCrawlStateChangeEvent(CrawlController.java:960)
> 	- locked <0x88dc6210> (a java.util.Collections$SynchronizedRandomAccessList)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.completeStop(CrawlController.java:1032)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob$MBeanCrawlController.completeStop(CrawlJob.java:801)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController.toeEnded(CrawlController.java:1816)
> 	- locked <0x88dc4998> (a org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob$MBeanCrawlController)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:186)
> 
> Looking at the other threads in the dump, it seems that the toe thread is stuck contending with internal BDB threads for a BDB lock.
> Has anyone encountered anything like this before?
> 
> On Thu, 2008-08-28 at 00:30 -0700, Gordon Mohr wrote:
>> I'm guessing some timing interaction between your control program and 
>> Heritrix might be the cause.
>>
>> Which version of Heritrix are you using? What interface are you using
>> to 
>> start jobs?
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
>> Matt Kent wrote:
>>> I've got a strange problem with my crawl jobs that manifests itself
>>> regularly but not predictably. Every once in a while, a job will get
>>> stuck in the "Preparing" state and I have to manually intervene and
>> kill
>>> it.
>>>
>>> My situation is unusual because I've embedded Heritrix in a
>> long-running
>>> program that continuously submits and monitors jobs. The average job
>>> size is rather small, only about 300-500 URLs, and the average job
>> time
>>> is only about 3-5 minutes.
>>>
>>> Based on the jstack excerpt below, it looks like something tried to
>>> pause the job, but it never made it out of the "Preparing" state.
>>>
>>> "ToeThread #2" prio=10 tid=0x0a2fa000 nid=0x2380 in Object.wait()
>>> [0xb422e000..0xb422efc0]
>>> java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
>>> at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
>>> at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485)
>>> at
>>>
>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.preNext(AbstractFrontier.java:666)
>>> - locked <0x71c2e0f8> (a
>>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier)
>>> at
>>>
>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.next(WorkQueueFrontier.java:632)
>>> at
>>> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:144)
>>>
>>> "ToeThread #1" prio=10 tid=0x0a487400 nid=0x237f in Object.wait()
>>> [0xb3dce000..0xb3dcf040]
>>> java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
>>> at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
>>> at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485)
>>> at
>>>
>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.preNext(AbstractFrontier.java:666)
>>> - locked <0x71c2e0f8> (a
>>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier)
>>> at
>>>
>> org.archive.crawler.frontier.WorkQueueFrontier.next(WorkQueueFrontier.java:632)
>>> at
>>> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:144)
>>>
>>>
>>>
